member.name: Windows.GetDpiForMonitor
member.summary: Queries the dots per inch (dpi) of a display.
member.param: Handle of the monitor being queried.
The type of DPI being queried. Possible values are from the enumeration.
The value of the DPI along the X axis. This value always refers to the horizontal edge, even when the screen is rotated.
The value of the DPI along the Y axis. This value always refers to the vertical edge, even when the screen is rotated.

returns.para: This function returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The function successfully returns the X and Y DPI values for the specified monitor.
The handle, DPI type, or pointers passed in are not valid.

member.name: Windows.GetScaleFactorForMonitor
member.summary: Gets the scale factor of a specific monitor. This function replaces .

param.name: pScale
param.para: When this function returns successfully, this value points to one of the values that specify the scale factor of the specified monitor.
If the function call fails, this value points to a valid scale factor so that apps can opt to continue on with incorrectly sized resources.

member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Registers a window to receive callbacks when scaling information changes.
summary.div: Note This function is not supported as of Windows 8.1. Use instead.

member.param: The enum value that indicates which display device to receive notifications about.
The handle of the window that will receive the notifications.
An application-defined message that is passed to the window specified by hwndNotify when scaling information changes. Typically, this should be set to WM_APP+x, where x is an integer value.
